sense.name: a large furry omnivorous mammal
sense.examples: The rangers advise the tourists not to feed the bears in the park. The tracks along the trail were made by a grizzly bear. Bears will eat fish, berries, grubs and honey.

sense.name: a person who expects the stock markets to fall
sense.commentary: BEAR[+entity][+person][+role][+investor][+forecaster][+of_stock_market][+falling] Note: often refers to brokers, but can refer to anyone who thinks the market will go down.
sense.examples: The bears are predicting a large downward market correction. These investors are still bulls, not bears. John has always tended to be a bear and invested his retirement money very conservatively.

sense.name: a toy stuffed animal
sense.examples: The little boy got a new teddy bear for Christmas. This bear is very fancy and made by a German company. The child was tucked in at night with his favorite bear.
